//linear search or sequential search
#include<stdio.h>
#include<conio.h>
#include<process.h>
#define MAX 6

int LinearSearch(int a[],int n,int item);
int main()
{
int a[MAX];
int i,n,pos,item;

printf("Enter array size :");
scanf("%d",&n);

for(i=0; i<n; ++i)
{
 printf("\nEnter array element a[%d] :",i);
 scanf("%d",&a[i]);        
 }    
  
printf("\nArray is :");    
for(i=0; i<n; i++) 
{
 printf("%d  ",a[i]);        
 }
 
printf("\nEnter the number to be searched :");
scanf("%d",&item); 

pos=LinearSearch(a,n,item);

if(pos==-1)
printf("\nItem not fount in list");

else
printf("%d item searched in list and its position :%d",item,pos+1);

getch();
return 0;   
}

int LinearSearch(int a[],int n,int item)
{
 int i;
 for(i=0; i<n; ++i)
 {
  if(item==a[i])
   return i;        
 }
   return -1;                 
}
